H0.text: Evaporation is when liquid water changes to water vapor.

H1.text: Absorption is the process that occurs when liquid water changes to water vapor.

H2.text: Transpiration is the process when liquid water changes to water vapor.

A3.text: Evaporation is a type of vaporization that occurs on the surface of a liquid as it changes into the gas phase.

A4.text: In hydrology, evaporation and transpiration (which involves evaporation within plant stomata) are collectively termed evapotranspiration.

A5.text: Phase transitions commonly refer to when a substance transforms between one of the four states of matter to another.

A6.text: During a phase transition of a given medium, certain properties of the medium change as a result of the change of external conditions, such as temperature or pressure.
